sentences.sContent: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.sCn: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.sContent: ...A couple of recent papers have finally opened a window on these people’s extraordinary minds...
...are a vigorous recent addition to the beverage...
...the report portrays an overall optimism borne by the recent healthy real-estate “upcycle” and improving economy...
...A recent study of people with HSAM reveals that they are liable to fantasy and full absorption in an activity...
...sleep duration has declined from some 8 hours in the 1950s to 7 in recent years...
...At first the researchers of the most recent study found residents in assisted living facilities gave higher scores on social interaction...
...That also includes a recent citywide ban and artificial trans-fats in restaurant food...
...recent developments in electric vehicle technology mean they can match conventional petrol engines in terms of performance and safety...
...It is sunburn that is most worrying recent research shows five episodes of sunburn in the teenage years increases the risk of all skin cancers...

trans.tranOther: having happened or started only a short time ago
